intro: Mariscus phleoides subsp. hawaiiensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian mariscus, is a rare endemic plant native to the island of Hawaii. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as mesic forests and streamside areas. It has finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white to pale green flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
